data.title: Visits by Foreign Leaders
data.text: Prime Minister Liaquat Ali Khan Official visit. Afterwards visited New York City, Chicago, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Houston, New Orleans (Louisiana), Schenectady (New York), and Boston (Massachusetts). Departed U.S. May 30. May 3–5, 1950 Governor General Ghulam Mohammed Met with President Eisenhower after obtaining medical treatment in Boston (Massachusetts). November 8–13, 1953 Prime Minister Mohammed Ali Official guest. October 14–21, 1954 Prime Minister Suhrawardy Official visit. Afterwards visited Colorado Springs (Colorado), the Grand Canyon (Arizona), Los Angeles, San Francisco, Salt Lake City (Utah), Omaha (Nebraska), Detroit (Michigan), and New York City. Departed U.S. July 27. July 10–13, 1957 President Ayub Khan State visit. Addressed U.S. Congress July 12. Afterwards visited New York City, Gettysburg (Pennsylvania), San Antonio, Austin, and the LBJ Ranch (Texas). Departed U.S. July 18. July 11–14, 1961 President Ayub Khan Informal meeting at Newport (Rhode Island). Afterwards visited Washington and New York City. Departed U.S. September 27. September 24, 1962 President Ayub Khan State visit. Arrived in U.S. December 12; visited New York City. December 14–16, 1965 President Agha Muhammad Yahya Khan Attended White House dinner on 25th Anniversary of the U.N; met privately with President Nixon October 25. October 24–25, 1970 Prime Minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto Official visit. In U.S. September 17–24; visited Williamsburg, San Francisco, and New York City. September 18–20, 1973 Prime Minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto Official visit. Afterwards visited New York City. Departed U.S. February 8. February 4–7, 1975 President Muhammad Zia ul-Haq Private visit while attending U.N. General Assembly session. October 3, 1980 President Muhammad Zia ul-Haq State visit; visited New York City, Houston, Sacramento, and San Francisco. Departed U.S. December 14. December 6–9, 1982 President Muhammad Zia ul-Haq Met with President Reagan in New York City at reception and luncheon at the U.N. October 23, 1985 Prime Minister Muhammad Khan Junejo Official Visit; visited Orlando (Fla.) and New York City. Departed U.S. July 22. July 15–18, 1986 Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto Official Visit; visited Boston and New York City. Departed U.S. June 10. June 5–7, 1989 President Farooq Leghari Arrived in U.S. May 21; departed June 1. Also visited Rochester, NY. Met with President Clinton during a private visit. Later visited New York City. May 23–27, 1994 Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto Official working visit. Arrived in the U.S. April 5; also visited New York City and Los Angeles. Departed the U.S. April 14. April 9–11, 1995 Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif Met with President Clinton at the UN General Assembly in New York City. September 22, 1997 Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif Met with President Clinton at the U.N. General Assembly in New York City. September 21, 1998 Prime Minister Mohammed Nawaz Sharif Official working visit. December 1, 1998 Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif Discussed the Kashmir crisis with President Clinton during a private visit. July 4–5, 1999 President Pervez Musharraf Met with President Bush at the UN General Assembly in New York City. November 10, 2001 President Pervez Musharraf Official Working Visit. February 12–14, 2002 President Pervez Musharraf Met with President Bush at the UN General Assembly in New York City. September 12, 2002 President Pervez Musharraf Working visit. Met with President Bush in Washington, DC and Camp David, MD. Arrived in Boston June 20; later visited Los Angeles. June 23–27, 2003 President Pervez Musharraf Met with President Bush at the UN General Assembly in New York City. September 24, 2003 Prime Minister Mir Zafarullah Khan Jamali Working visit. September 30–October 4, 2003 President Pervez Musharraf Met with President Bush at the UN General Assembly in New York City. September 21–22, 2004 President Pervez Musharraf Working visit. September 20–22, 2006 Prime Minister Yousuf Gillani Working visit. July 27–30, 2008 President Asif Ali Zardari Working Visit. May 6, 2009 President Asif Zardari Attended a meeting of the Friends of Democratic Pakistan Summit in New York City September 24–25, 2009 Prime Minister Yusuf Raza Gilani Attended the Nuclear Security Summit. April 11–13, 2010 President Asif Ali Zardari Attended the Richard Holbrooke Memorial Service. January 14, 2011 President Asif Zadari Met with President Obama at the NATO Summit Meeting in Chicago, IL. May 21, 2012 Prime Minister Mohammed Nawaz Sharif Working visit. October 20–23, 2013 Prime Minister Mohammed Nawaz Sharif Official Working Visit. October 22, 2015
